title: Mod-02 Lec-02 Our Agriculture Practices and Lessons

tasks.task: Understanding the impact of agricultural practices on the environment and adaptation strategies.
subtasks: Defining the scope of agriculture in terms of food, fiber, biofuel, and medicinal products.
Discussing measures to enhance crop yield such as modern agronomy, plant breeding, pesticides, and fertilizers.
Recognizing the ecological and health implications of intensive agricultural practices.
Analyzing the role of land use, irrigation, and water management in agriculture.
Exploring the challenges of water allocation and reallocation in agricultural settings.
Evaluating the effects of tillage, pest control, and nutrient management on soil health and water resources.
Assessing the consequences of chemical and biological inputs on soil and water quality.
Addressing the issues of land degradation, including deforestation, desertification, and soil erosion.
Managing irrigation and waterlogging to prevent salinization and maintain agricultural productivity.
Considering the role of sustainable agricultural practices in mitigating climate change and environmental degradation.
Discussing the future direction of agriculture in balancing production needs with environmental sustainability.
